title: Голова Єврокомісії: Маємо науку. Треба було прислухатися до голосів Польщі та балтійських країн
text: Якщо ми проявимо необхідну хоробрість і солідарність, Путін зазнає поразки, а Україна і Європа переможуть, - заявила в Європарламенті голова Єврокомісії Урсула фон дер Ляєн. Вона також визнала, що "необхідно було прислухатися до голосів всередині Євросоюзу, в Польщі та країнах Балтії" щодо Володимира Путіна.Українське телебачення в прямому ефіріБезкоштовно та без реєстраціїUkraińska telewizja na żywoBezpłatnie i bez rejestracji.1+1 w TVN24 GO            Ukraina 24 w PLAYER            Голова Єврокомісії Урсула фон дер Ляєн виступила в середу під час дебатів про стан ЄС в Європейському парламенті в Страсбурзі. Щороку у вересні президент Європейської комісії приїжджає до Європейського парламенту, щоб обговорити з депутатами діяльність Комісії за минулий рік і плани на майбутнє. Цього разу спеціальним гостем дебатів була перша леді України Олена Зеленська.Ставка висока- Скажімо чітко: ставка висока. Не тільки для України, а для всієї Європи і всього світу. Нас чекає важке випробування. Випробування, якому нас піддають ті, хто хоче скористатися всіма розбіжностями поміж нами. Це не тільки війна, яку Росія розв'язала проти України. Це війна за нашу енергію, нашу економіку, наші цінності, боротьба за наше майбутнє. Боротьба автократії з демократією. Я переконана, що завдяки нашій мужності та солідарності Путін програє, а Європа виграє, - заявила глава Єврокомісії.Як підкреслила фон дер Ляєн, звертаючись до Олени Зеленської, останні дні показали, що мужність українців дає свої плоди.- Ви дали слово українцям і українкам на світовій арені. І ви дали нам усім надію. Тож сьогодні ми дякуємо вам і всім українцям і українкам. Слава державі європейських героїв! Слава Україні! Солідарність Європи з Україною залишиться безсумнівною. З першого дня Європа була на боці України. Підтримуючи її зброєю, фінансовими ресурсами та гостинністю для біженців. І найсуворішими санкціями, які будь-коли існували у світі, - доводила вона.Олена Зеленська – гостя дебатів у ЄвропарламентіCHRISTOPHE PETIT TESSON/PAP/EPA"Кремль довів російську економіку до краху"Глава Єврокомісії заявила, що санкції Заходу були ефективними. - Російський фінансовий сектор ледве дихає. Ми відрізали три чверті російського банківського сектора від міжнародних ринків. Країну покинули майже тисяча транснаціональних компаній. Виробництво автомобілів впало на три четверті порівняно з минулим роком. Літаки "Аерофлоту" не літають через відсутність запчастин. Російські військові знімають мікросхеми з посудомийних машин і холодильників для ремонту військової техніки, оскільки напівпровідників більше немає. Російська промисловість винищена. Саме Кремль штовхнув російську економіку до краху. Це ціна за смерть і руйнування, завдані Путіним. Скажу чітко - санкції будуть збережені. Настав час бути рішучими і не йти на жодні поступки, - сказала вона.Урсула фон дер Ляєн заявила, що разом із Зеленською підтримуватиме відновлення зруйнованих українських шкіл. - Ми виділимо на це сто мільйонів євро. Бо майбутнє України починається зі школи, - додала вона.Голова Єврокомісії заявила також, що ЄС включить Україну в європейську зону безкоштовного роумінгу. - Комісія працюватиме з Україною, щоб забезпечити плавний доступ до єдиного ринку. І навпаки. Наш єдиний ринок є одним із найбільших успіхів Європи. Настав час поширити цей успішний проект і на наших українських друзів. Тому я сьогодні вирушаю до Києва, щоб детально обговорити це питання з президентом Зеленським, - підкреслила вона.Дебати про стан Європейського Союзу в ЄвропарламентіCHRISTOPHE PETIT TESSON/PAP/EPAГолова Єврокомісії: маємо наукуФон дер Ляєн говорила, зокрема, про дії ЄС в умовах російської агресії проти України. - Європейці продемонстрували сміливість зробити те, що потрібно було зробити. Європейський Союз загалом виявився на висоті. Як тільки російські війська перетнули український кордон, наша реакція була солідарна. Ми можемо цим пишатися. (…) Якщо ми проявимо необхідну мужність і солідарність, Путін зазнає поразки, а Україна та Європа переможуть, - сказала вона.Урсула фон дер Ляєн також розповіла про "уроки цієї війни". - Треба було прислухатися до тих, хто знає Путіна, хто мав з ним справу в минулому. До Анни Політковської і всіх тих російських журналістів, які викривали злочини і заплатили за це найвищу ціну. До наших друзів в Україні, Молдові, Грузії, опозиціонерів з Білорусі. Треба було прислухатися до голосів, які лунали всередині нашого Союзу: у Польщі, у країнах Балтії та в країнах Центральної та Східної Європи. Ці голоси роками говорили нам, що Путін не зупиниться, - сказала вона.Урсула фон дер Ляєн під час виступуEPA/CHRISTOPHE PETIT TESSONЗалежність від палива з РосіїУрсула фон дер Ляйєн підкреслила, що ЄС повинен покінчити із своєю залежність від викопного палива з Росії. - Відходячи від поставок з Росії, ми забезпечуємо імпорт від надійних постачальників: із США, Норвегії, Алжиру та інших країн. Торік російський газ становив 40 відсотків нашого газового імпорту. Сьогодні цей показник знизився до 9 відсотків газу, що транспортується по трубопроводах. Проте Росія продовжує маніпулювати нашим енергетичним ринком. Замість того, щоб постачати газ, Росія вважає за краще його спалювати, - зазначила вона.Фон дер Ляєн також повідомила, що Єврокомісія запропонує заходи у відповідь на високі ціни на енергоносії. - Ми пропонуємо обмеження доходу для компаній, які виробляють електроенергію з низькими витратами. Ці компанії отримують доходи, на які вони ніколи не розраховували, про які навіть не сміли мріяти. У нашій соціальній ринковій економіці прибутки - явище позитивне. Однак у наш час отримувати рекордні прибутки від війни за рахунок споживачів неприпустимо. Сьогодні нам потрібно ділитися нашими прибутками та направляти їх тим, хто їх найбільше потребує. Завдяки нашій пропозиції країни-члени отримають понад 140 мільярдів євро для безпосереднього пом’якшення потрясінь, - пояснила вона.Олена Зеленська, Роберта Мецола (президент Європарламенту) та Урсула фон дер ЛяєнCHRISTOPHE PETIT TESSON/PAP/EPAА також додала, що оскільки нинішня криза пов’язана з викопним паливом, перед добувною промисловостю теж стоїть конкретне завдання. - Великі нафтові, газові та вугільні компанії отримують високі прибутки. Тож їм доведеться чесно ними ділитися - віддавати частину, отриманого завдяки кризі. Усі рішення, над якими ми працюємо, є винятковими та тимчасовими заходами. Це також стосується наших дискусій щодо граничних цін. Ми повинні продовжувати працювати над зниженням ціни на газ. Ми повинні гарантувати безпеку поставок, одночасно забезпечуючи нашу глобальну конкурентоспроможність, - сказала вона.Урсула фон дер Ляєн визнала, що ЄС працює над встановленням "більш репрезентативної" базової ціни на газ, ніж та, яку формує голландський хаб TTF, де ціни на газ різко зросли. - Треба припинити домінуючий вплив газу на ціни електроенергії. Для цього ми проведемо глибоку та комплексну реформу ринку електроенергії, - підкреслила вона.Фон дер Ляєн також розповіла про ринок водню, який, як вона підкреслила, може стати проривом в європейській енергетиці.- Ринок водню має стати масовим, а не нішевим, як це було досі. План REPowerEU дозволив нам подвоїти нашу мету - до 2030 року ми хочемо виробляти у Європейському Союзі десять мільйонів тонн відновлюваного водню на рік. Щоб досягти цього, на ринку має з’явитися суб’єкт, здатний керувати процесом, щоб можна було заповнити прогалину інвестицій і узгодити майбутню пропозицію з попитом. Тому сьогодні я можу оголосити, що ми створимо новий Європейський банк водню. Банк виступить гарантом закупівлі водню, в тому числі за рахунок коштів інноваційного фонду. Банк зможе інвестувати 3 мільярди євро в розвиток майбутнього водневого ринку. Таким чином ми побудуємо економіку майбутнього, - підкреслила вона.Урсула фон дер Ляєн про Європейський банк воднюTVN24Подвоєння здатності боротися з пожежамиГолова Єврокомісії оголосила, що наступного року ЄС подвоїть свої можливості боротьби з пожежами. - Євросоюз поповнить свій флот десятьма легкими літаками-амфібіями та трьома додатковими гелікоптерами. Це європейська солідарність на практиці, - сказала вона.Окрім того оголосила створення "Європейського закону про критичну сировину". - Ми знаємо, що такий підхід може принести результати. П'ять років тому Європа заснувала альянс акумуляторів. Незабаром дві третини необхідних нам акумуляторів будуть виробляти в Європі. Минулого року я поставила завдання створення європейських чіпів. Тепер, у найближчі місяці, розпочнеться будівництво першої гігафабрики чіпів. І тепер ми повинні повторити успіх, - сказала вона.Запрошення Магдалени та АгнєшкиУрсула фон дер Ляєн запросила до Європарламенту двох польок, які допомагали біженцям з України. - Щойно почули про потяги, наповнені біженцями, вони поспішили на Центральний вокзал у Варшаві, - сказала голова Єврокомісії.- Кажуть, що в темряві світло сяє найяскравіше. Власне так можуть сказати жінки і діти, які рятуються від російських бомб. Вони втекли з країни, охопленої війною, сповнені смутку через те, що їм довелося залишити, і страхом перед тим, що їх ще чекає. Але їх зустріли з розпростертими обіймами. Багато людей таких як Магдалена та Агнєшка. Дві самовіддані молоді жінки з Польщі. Як тільки почули про потяги, наповнені біженцями, вони поспішили на Центральний вокзал у Варшаві. Вони почали самоорганізовуватися. Поставили намет, щоб допомогти якомога більшій кількості людей. Організували харчування з супермаркетів, просили місцеву владу забезпечити автобусами до пунктів прийому. За кілька днів вони зібрали 3000 волонтерів, які допомагали приймати біженців 24 години на добу, сім днів на тиждень, – розповіла голова Єврокомісії під час дебатів про стан ЄС.Обох польок євродепутати вітали бурхливими оплесками. - Це дух Європи. Союзу, який міцний своєю єдністю. Союз, який єдністю перемагає. Хай живе Європа! - виголосила фон дер Ляєн.Голова Єврокомісії також повідомила, що ще в середу вирушає до Києва на переговори з президентом України Володимиром Зеленським.TVN24 na żywo - oglądaj w TVN24 GOMateriał jest częścią serwisu TVN24 GOAutor:red.Źródło: PAP, TVN24Źródło zdjęcia głównego: EPA/CHRISTOPHE PETIT TESSON
title_EN: The Chairman of the European Commission: We have science.It was necessary to listen to the votes of Poland and Baltic countries
text_EN: If we show the necessary courage and solidarity, Putin will be defeated, and Ukraine and Europe will defeat, - said the head of the European Commission Ursula von Der Lyen in the European Parliament. She also acknowledged that "it was necessary to listen to the votes within the European Union, in Poland and the Baltic countries" regarding Vladimir Putin. The European Commission Ursula von Der Lyen spokes on Wednesday during the EU's debate in the European Parliament in Strasbourg. Every year in September, the President of the European Commission comes to the European Parliament to discuss the activities of the Commission for the past year and the future. This time, the special guest of the debate was the first lady of Ukraine Olena Zelenska. Not only for Ukraine, but for the whole of Europe and the whole world. We are waiting for a difficult test. The trial that we are subjected to those who want to take advantage of all the differences between us. It is not only the war that Russia has solved against Ukraine. It is a war for our energy, our economy, our values, the struggle for our future. The struggle of autocracy with democracy. I am convinced that thanks to our courage and solidarity, Putin is losing, and Europe wins, - said the head of the European Commission. As von Der Lyen emphasized, addressing Elena Zelenskaya, the last days showed that the courage of Ukrainians is giving their fruits. on the world stage. And you gave us all hope. So today we thank you and all Ukrainians and Ukrainians. Glory to the state of European heroes! Glory to Ukraine! The solidarity of Europe with Ukraine will remain undoubted. From the first day, Europe was on the side of Ukraine. Supporting its weapons, financial resources and hospitality for refugees. And the harshest sanctions that had ever existed in the world, she proved. The Green Guest of Debates in the European Parliamentichischrisho Petit TESSON/PAP/EPA "Kremlin brought the Russian economy to the collapse of the" European Commission Head of the European Commission. - The Russian financial sector is barely breathing. We cut off three -quarters of the Russian banking sector from international markets. Almost a thousand transnational companies left the country. The production of cars fell on three fourths compared to last year. Aeroflot planes do not fly due to the lack of spare parts. The Russian military is removing the dishwashers and refrigerators to repair military equipment, since there are no more semiconductors. The Russian industry is exterminated. It was the Kremlin who pushed the Russian economy to collapse. This is the price for death and destruction caused by Putin. I will say clearly - sanctions will be saved. It is time to be decisive and not make no concessions, ”she said. The Undershot Der Liaien said that she will support the restoration of destroyed Ukrainian schools together with Zelensk. - We will allocate one hundred million euros. Because the future of Ukraine begins with school, ”she added. The Chairman of the European Commission also stated that the EU will include Ukraine in the European free roaming zone. - The commission will work with Ukraine to provide smooth access to a single market. And vice versa. Our only market is one of Europe's greatest success. It is time to extend this successful project to our Ukrainian friends. So today I go to Kiev to discuss this issue with President Zelensky in detail, she emphasized. Debates about the state of the European Union in the European Parliamenticchristophe Petit TESSON/PAP/EPACEPPEPEPLY OF THE US against Ukraine. - Europeans demonstrated the courage to do what they had to do. The European Union was generally altitude. As soon as the Russian troops crossed the Ukrainian border, our reaction was solidarity. We can be proud of it. (…) If we show the necessary courage and solidarity, Putin will be defeated, and Ukraine and Europe will win, ”she said. Urrezula von Der Lyen also spoke about the Lessons of this War. - It was necessary to listen to those who know Putin, who had a deal with him in the past. To Anna Politkovskaya and all those Russian journalists who exposed crimes and paid the highest price. To our friends in Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia, oppositionists from Belarus. It was necessary to listen to the voices that were heard within our union: in Poland, in the Baltic States and in Central and Eastern Europe. These voices have told us for years that Putin would not stop, ”she said. The Undershot Der Lyen during a speech/christophe petit type dependence on fuel from Russia from Russia von Der Layen emphasized that the EU should end its dependence on fossil fuel from Russia. - Departing from Russia, we provide imports from reliable suppliers: from the USA, Norway, Algeria and other countries. Last yearThe gas gas was 40 percent of our gas imports. Today, this figure has decreased to 9 percent of gas transported through pipelines. However, Russia continues to manipulate our energy market. Instead of supplying gas, Russia prefers to burn it, ”she said. Fon Der Lyen also reported that the European Commission will offer measures in response to high energy prices. - We offer income limits for low -cost electricity companies. These companies receive income that they have never calculated, which they have not even dreamed of dreaming. In our social market economy, profits are positive. However, in our time, it is unacceptable to receive record earnings from war at the expense of consumers. Today, we need to share our profits and direct them to those who need them most. Thanks to our proposal, the Member States will receive more than 140 billion euros to direct a softening of shocks, ”she explained. Olena Zelenskaya, Robert Metzola (President of the European Parliament) and Ursula von Der LiaenchRistophe Petit Tesson/Pap/Pap/EPAA It is with fossil fuel, and the extractive industry also has a specific task. - Large oil, gas and coal companies earn high profits. So they will have to share them honestly -to give part obtained through the crisis. All the decisions we work on are exceptional and temporary measures. This also applies to our discussions on marginal prices. We need to continue to work on reducing gas prices. We need to guarantee the safety of deliveries while providing our global competitiveness, ”she said. Urban Fon Der Lyen has recognized that the EU has been working on establishing a" more representative "basic gas price than the one that forms the Dutch Hub TTF, where gas prices are sharply increased. - The dominant effect of gas on electricity prices should be stopped. To do this, we will carry out a deep and comprehensive reform of the electricity market, ”she emphasized. Fon Der Lyen also told the hydrogen market, which, as she emphasized, can be a breakthrough in European energy. It was still. The rePowreu plan allowed us to double our goal - by 2030 we want to produce ten million tons of renewable hydrogen in the European Union for a year. In order to achieve this, an entity capable of managing the process should appear on the market so that the investment gap can be filled and the future supply is in demand. So today I can announce that we will create a new European Hydrogen Bank. The bank will guarantee the procurement of hydrogen, including at the expense of the innovation fund. The Bank will be able to invest € 3 billion in the development of the future hydrogen market. In this way, we will build the economy of the future, - it emphasized. Understanding von der Liaien about the European Bank of Hydustvn24 Expanding the ability to fight the fires of the European Commission's fires that the EU will double its firefighting opportunities next year. - The European Union will replenish its fleet with ten light aircraft-amphibians and three additional helicopters. It is European solidarity in practice, ”she said. Ok, in addition, the creation of the European Law on Critical Raw materials. - We know that this approach can produce results. Five years ago, Europe founded the Battery Alliance. Soon the two -thirds of the batteries we need will produce in Europe. Last year, I set the task of creating European chips. Now, in the coming months, the construction of the first chip hygaphabrika will begin. And now we have to repeat success, ”she said. Magdalen's request and Agnevskulus von Der Lyen invited two polts to the European Parliament that helped refugees from Ukraine. "They just heard about the refugee trains, they hurried to the central station in Warsaw," said the European Commission Head. "They say that in the darkness the light shines brightest. Actually, women and children who escape from Russian bombs can say so. They escaped from the country covered by the war, filled with sadness because they had to leave, and fear before what was still waiting. But they were met with outstretched arms. Many people such as Magdalen and Agnieszka. Two selfless young women from Poland. As soon as they heard about the trains filled with refugees, they hurried to the central station in Warsaw. They began to organize themselves. Put a tent to help as many people as possible. They organized food from supermarkets, asked the local authorities to provide buses to reception points. In a few days, they gathered 3,000 volunteers who helped to take refugees 24 hours a day, seven days a week, - said the head of the European Commission during the EU's debate. - This is the spirit of Europe. An alliance that is strong with its unity. UnityACTH.Let Europe live!- said the background of the Der Lyen.Helov of the European Commission also reported that on Wednesday it went to Kiev for negotiations with President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky.TVN24 Na żywo - oglądaj w tvn24 Gomateriałylo:EPA/Christophe Petit Tesson

title: Побачила по телевізору українського вояка і написала йому. Через кілька місяців вони одружилися
text: Кілька місяців тому 31-річна варшавянка Агата побачила в репортажі "Superwizjera" українського військового Колю. - Він мені дуже сподобався, такий гарний. Я ризикнула, запросила його до знайомих і написала коротке повідомлення. Він відповів і з цього почалася вся наша історія, – розповіла вона. Історія закінчилася весіллям у Києві. Фрагмент репортажу "Superwizjera".Українське телебачення в прямому ефіріБезкоштовно та без реєстраціїUkraińska telewizja na żywoBezpłatnie i bez rejestracji.1+1 w TVN24 GO            Ukraina 24 w PLAYER            "Superwizjer", чи не від самого початку війни в Україні, стежив за діяльністю підрозділу "Вови". У серії репортажів Міхал Пшедляцький показав як дії на фронті, так і звичайне життя бійців - Вови, Ірини та Колі.Після виходу одного з перших репортажів на зв'язок з Колею вийшла 31-річна полька Агата з Варшави. - Я вперше побачила його по телевізору, він мені дуже сподобався, такий гарний. Я ризикнула, запросила його до приятелів і написала коротке повідомлення. Він відповів і з цього почалася вся наша історія, - розповіла вона.Агата і Коля SuperwizjerПісля п'яти днів знайомства Коля зробив Агаті пропозицію. Вона погодилася, незважаючи на небезпеку війни, і почала готуватися до весілля і від'їзду до Києва. У столиці на неї чекав Коля з букетом квітів. - Це був вибух щастя, нам було байдуже до всіх навколо, - згадувала Агата.Плани молодої пари перекреслила воєнна дійсність. Чиновники не дали дозволу за першим разом, оскільки Агату мала перевірити українська контррозвідка. Через місяць вона повернулася до Києва. Цього разу аби вже без проблем вийти заміж за Колю. Вона стала дружиною бійця, який незабаром знову опиниться на передовій.Агата і Коля SuperwizjerKanał 1+1 na żywo - oglądaj w TVN24 GOMateriał jest częścią serwisu TVN24 GOAutor:Ред. title: Україна хоче експортувати вугілля до Польщі. Зеленський: у нас достатньо запасів
text: Президент України Володимир Зеленський повідомив, що доручив уряду розробити можливість термінової поставки до Польщі 100 тис. тонн вугілля. "У нас достатньо запасів, щоб допомогти нашим братам підготуватися до цієї зими", - сказав він. Раніше прем'єр-міністр України Денис Шмигаль заявляв, що експорт мав би відбутися у вересні.Українське телебачення в прямому ефіріБезкоштовно та без реєстраціїUkraińska telewizja na żywoBezpłatnie i bez rejestracji.1+1 w TVN24 GO            Ukraina 24 w PLAYER            "Ми підтримуємо наших польських друзів. Від імені Президента України ми готові відкрити квоти на експорт вугілля до Польщі. Це 100 тисяч тонн у вересні, які дуже потрібні нашому партнеру. З ррем’єр-міністром Матеушем Моравецьким ми обговорили спільний план дій", - написав у суботу прем'єр-міністр України Денис Шмигаль у Twitter.Зеленський: ми можемо допомогти нашим братамПрезидент України Володимир Зеленський також торкнувся вугільної теми в записі, опублікованому в Telegram у суботу ввечері. - Після вчорашніх домовленостей з прем'єр-міністром Матеушем Моравецьким я провів нараду, присвячену підтримці наших братів поляків у сфері енергетичного співробітництва восени і взимку, - повідомив він.Він поінформував, що доручив уряду розробити можливість термінової поставки 100 тис. тонн сировини. - У нас достатньо запасів і ми можемо допомогти нашим братам підготуватися до цієї зими, - запевнив керівник української держави.Раніше речник польського уряду Пьотр Мюллер підтвердив, що "Україна запропонувала підтримку" щодо поставок вугілля. - Прем'єр-міністр Матеуш Моравецький обговорив у Києві питання енергетики. На даний момент завершуються переговори на робочому рівні, - сказав він.Два мільйони тонн запасуТакож прем'єр Шмигаль опублікував запис у комунікаторі Telegram, у якому наголосив, що «зараз ми разом з Євросоюзом готуємося пережити найважчу зиму за багато років». Він зазначив, що запаси вугілля на українських складах становлять майже 2 мільйони тонн, що в 2,5 рази більше, ніж за аналогічний період минулого року.Прем’єр-міністр України також поінформував про перебіг робіт на лінії електропередач Хмельницька АЕС - Жешув. "Ми планували завершити до 14 грудня, але завдяки прискоренню робіт ми можемо завершити (їх - ред.) на тиждень раніше. Це дозволить експортувати до Польщі додатково 1000 МВт", - додав він.Про прискорення оновлення ЛЕП між Хмельницькою АЕС і Жешувом у вечірньому відеозверненні також розповів Президент Зеленський. Він наголосив, що ремонтні роботи мають завершитися до 8 грудня, і "Польща має отримати необхідну кількість енергії". - Звичайно, все це буде можливо за умови, що Україна збереже нормальний контроль над Запорізькою АЕС, - сказав він.TVN24 na żywo - oglądaj w TVN24 GOMateriał jest częścią serwisu TVN24 GOAutor:akr/kabŹródło: tvn24.pl/PAPŹródło zdjęcia głównego: PAP/EPA/SERGEY DOLZHENKO
title_EN: Ukraine wants to export coal to Poland.Zelensky: We have enough stocks
text_EN: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky said that he instructed the government to develop an opportunity for urgent delivery to Poland 100,000 tons of coal. "We have enough stocks to help our brothers prepare for this winter," he said. Earlier, Prime Minister of Ukraine Denis Shmigal stated that exports should take place in September. . On behalf of the President of Ukraine, we are ready to open coal export quotas to Poland. These are 100,000 tons in September, which are very much needed by our partner. We discussed a joint plan of action with Rreener Mateusz Moravetsky, "the prime minister wrote on Saturday -Minister of Ukraine Denis Shmigal on Twitter.Elensky: We can help our Brotherly President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy also touched on a coal topic on the record published on Telegram on Saturday night. - After yesterday's agreements with Prime Minister Mateusz Moravtsky, I held a meeting on the support of our Poles brothers in the field of energy cooperation in the fall and winter, - he said. - We have enough stocks and we can help our brothers prepare for this winter, - assured the head of the Ukrainian state. The first spokesman for the Polish government Piotr Muller confirmed that "Ukraine has offered support" for coal supply. - Prime Minister Mateusz Moravetsky discussed in Kiev the issue of energy. At the moment negotiations at the working level are being completed, - he said. Two millions of tons of stock, the Prime Minister Smigal has published a record in the Telegram communicator, which stressed that "we are now preparing to survive the hardest winter over the age of many years." He noted that coal reserves in Ukrainian warehouses are almost 2 million tons, which is 2.5 times more than in the same period last year. The Prime Minister of Ukraine also informed about the course of work on the Khmelnytsky NPP - Rzeszow. "We planned to complete by December 14, but thanks to acceleration of work we can complete (ed.) A week earlier. This will allow to export 1000 MWh to Poland," he added. About acceleration President Zelensky also told the video. He stressed that repair work should be completed by December 8, and "Poland should receive the required amount of energy." - Of course, all this will be possible if Ukraine retains normal control over the Zaporozhye NPP, - he said /EPA/Sergey Dolzhenko

title: Блащак зустрівся з Остіном у Німеччині
text: Віце-прем'єр-міністр і міністр національної оборони Маріуш Блащак зустрівся в Німеччині з міністром оборони США Ллойдом Дж. Остіном,- повідомили в Міноборони Польщі. Ще у Рамштайні Блащак зустрівся з міністром оборони Німеччини Крістін Ламбрехт.Українське телебачення в прямому ефіріБезкоштовно та без реєстраціїUkraińska telewizja na żywoBezpłatnie i bez rejestracji.1+1 w TVN24 GO            Ukraina 24 w PLAYER            "Розмова була присвячена двосторонньому військовому співробітництву та подальшій діяльності щодо підтримки України", – повідомило Міноборони у Twitter у четвер.У четвер на авіабазі США в Рамштайні (Німеччина) розпочалася п’ята зустріч міністрів оборони близько 40 країн, у тому числі Польщі, у рамках Консультативної групи з питань оборони України. Головував на переговорах міністр оборони США Ллойд Дж. Остін. У засіданні брав участь Генеральний секретар НАТО Єнс Столтенберг.На відкритті засідання Консультативної групи Ллойд Остін заявив, що президент США Джо Байден схвалив черговий пакет військової допомоги Україні на 675 мільйонів доларів. Як він підкреслив, зустріч у Рамштайні присвячена в основному подальшим можливостям підготовки військових з України та "зміцненню можливостей військової промисловості (союзних держав) у довгостроковій перспективі".Зустріч з міністром оборони НімеччиниБлащак також зустрівся з міністром оборони Німеччини Крістін Ламбрехт. - Міністр звернулася до мене з проханням підтримати німецькі зусилля,пов’язаних із сервісним обслуговуванням та модернізацією німецького обладнання. Звичайно, я відповів, що такі можливості є, у групи PGZ такі можливості є, звичайно на комерційній основі, - сказав віце-прем’єр.- В кожному разі, контакти PGZ з німецькими оборонними підприємствами вже були, вони були не найефективнішими, наприклад модернізація танків Leopard до рівня 2PL. Через певну повільність німецької сторони терміни цієї модернізації вже давно перевищені, але я сподіваюся, що зараз, коли німецька сторона просить нас, польський ВПК відкритий. Бізнес є бізнес, ми сподіваємося, що ця співпраця - коли йдеться про ремонт німецької техніки польською оборонною промисловістю - складеться, - сказав він.Відповідаючи на питання про заміщення польських поставок в Україну танками з Німеччини, він зазначив, що "ми отримали пропозицію, яка нас не задовольнила, тому що німці пропонували нам до 20 танків наступного року". - Я письмово відповів своїй колезі, що мінімальна кількість танків, яка нас цікавить, - це батальйон, і це в західноєвропейському розумінні, тобто 44 танки», - сказав Блащак, додавши, що поки не отримав відповіді на свій лист.Підготовка українських військових - одне із першочергових завдань Наступний пакет американської допомоги Україні складатиметься, зокрема, з боєприпасів для артилерійських систем HIMARS, а також транспортних засобів та індивідуального спорядження для солдатів, - повідомила раніше Washington Post, спираючись на заяви анонімного урядовця США.Тим часом представник посольства Великої Британії у Вашингтоні Марк Ньютон повідомив у середу, що під час зустрічі в Німеччині буде оголошено про постачання Україні додатково ракетних артилерійських систем. Він додав, що одним із головних пріоритетів у підтримці Києва має стати підготовка українських військових.Консультативна група була створена в Рамштайні 26 квітня. Тоді міністр оборони США Остін заявив після переговорів представників міністерств оборони кількох десятків країн НАТО і з-поза НАТО, що вирішено створити платформу міжнародної співпраці, яка збиратиметься щомісяця для координації збройної допомоги Україні.Kanał 1+1 na żywo - oglądaj w TVN24 GOMateriał jest częścią serwisu TVN24 GOAutor:mjzŹródło: PAPŹródło zdjęcia głównego: twitter.com/mblaszczak

text_EN: Vice Prime Minister and National Defense Minister Mariusz Blaschak met in Germany with US Secretary of Defense Lloyd J. Austin,-the Polish Defense Ministry reported. The meeting was attended by NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg. The opening of the meeting of the advisory group Lloyd Austin said that US President Joe Biden approved another $ 675 million military assistance package. As he emphasized, the Ramstay's meeting is devoted mainly to the further opportunities for military training from Ukraine and to "strengthen the opportunities of the military industry (the Union States) in the long run." - The minister appealed to me to support German efforts related to the service and modernization of German equipment. Repeating the question of the replacement of Polish supplies to Ukraine with tanks from Germany, he noted that "we received a proposal, which We were not satisfied because the Germans offered us until 20 tanks next year. " - I replied in writing to my colleague that the minimum number of tanks that interest us is a battalion, and this is in the Western European sense, that is, 44 tanks, "said Blaschak, adding that he had not received a letter to his letter. One of the priority tasks of the next package of American assistance to Ukraine will consist of, in particular, ammunition for HIMAR artillery systems, as well as vehicles and individual equipment for soldiers, - said the Washington Post, based on the statements of the anonymous government official. Washington Mark Newton reported on Wednesday that during a meeting in Germany, additional rocket artillery systems would be supplied to Ukraine. He added that one of the main priorities in the support of Kiev should be the preparation of the Ukrainian soldiers. The consultative group was created in Ramstin on April 26. "Of course, I agree with Professor Krasnod?bski, and I watched these stupid and boorish comments with disgust. But unfortunately, the opposition has so stained the Polish public space that only insults are heard from that side, while no reasonable opinion is heard," says Law and Justice MEP Prof. Ryszard Legutko in an interview with wPolityce.pl.  
wPolityce.pl: Prof. Zdzislaw Krasnod?bski's opinion that "the threat to our sovereignty from the West is greater than from the East" was met with huge criticism from the opposition. Do you agree with the opinion expressed by Prof. Krasnod?bski, taking into account the whole context of the statement of your colleague from the European Parliament? 
Prof. Ryszard Legutko: It would have been better if there had been careful and focused consideration of what was said by Prof. Krasnod?bski, who is a man who is not only wise, but also very experienced in EU affairs. He is extremely involved in it and knows a lot about it. Rather, such people should be listened to, in any case, reflect with seriousness on what they say. I, of course, agree with him. He told the truth. In the sense that the threat from Russia is powerful, maybe not direct, but powerful. However, the vast majority of Poles are aware of this. On the other hand, a threat of a different kind, but one that could also result in the loss of all sovereignty, comes from the West, from the European Union. And of this at least half of Poles are completely unaware. They think that the Union is such a nice place, because the high development of civilization, popular music, fashion houses. However, it is clear that the European Union has become such a very oligarchic structure, i.e. that the powerful rule there, and they say so bluntly. Chancellor Scholz talks about German leadership in the Union. If you go to the treaties, you won't find any passage about strong German leadership, or that of any other major country. If it so happens that institutional changes are made, such as the invigilation of the principle of unanimity, this will result in all major decisions being made outside of Poland. I know that this appeals to some. For example, former communists are delighted. For them, European institutions, this is something dreamed of. They were used to being the pushovers of the Soviets, pursuing their policy of progress, building socialism, and wanted to have all counter-revolutionaries under their boot. Now they are in a very similar situation. The policy of progress is being implemented and the Union is trying to keep the conservatives under the boot. The former communists are overjoyed, which should already be a signal to many reasonable-minded Poles: since the communists feel so great, maybe something is wrong. So there is a powerful threat.  Two things have become clear over the past few years when it comes to the Union. The first one I've already talked about, which is oligarchization - the strong states, the biggest political parties rule. On the other hand, let's not kid ourselves, Cyprus or Romania cannot say of themselves that they will lead the European Union. The second thing that makes it particularly dangerous for sovereignty or a complete loss of control over this is the notorious violation and circumvention of treaties. And this is the only weapon for these weaker countries. If the principle of unanimity is eliminated, or circumvented, as neatly as it is now, the weaker countries will be left completely without any say in what happens. Their role will be to sit at the table and agree, possibly getting some crumbs or a cinch for one politician or another from time to time. Still maybe some compliments that: please, from Eastern Europe, and so European. So this is an absolutely serious thing, and you need to think about it.  Of course, I agree with Professor Krasnod?bski, and I watched these stupid and boorish comments with disgust. But unfortunately, the opposition has so stained the Polish public space that only insults are heard from that side, while no reasonable opinion is heard. 
How can one read such a compliant PO politician, who argues that as soon as the government changes, funds for the National Reconstruction Plan will immediately flow to Poland? Dariusz Rosati told to choose - "the Law and Justice government or KPO funds." 
Mr. Rosati has a communist past, so this doesn't surprise me at all. This is the kind of statement that is incredibly demoralizing. What level is this? We have a government in Poland that we may like, some people voted for it, others did not. But that's how it is in a democracy - some win others lose, it's the natural order of things. Now the suggestion is that if we want to get this money, we have to overthrow the existing government. I thought that the election of the ruling party occurs as a result of the election of a certain program, not that some force, an outside entity conditions the payment of money on the vote. If a Polish politician, who in any case probably considers himself a Polish politician, tells the voter that he is to make a decision based on external, financial pressure, he is saying an absolutely demoralizing thing. It is a statement that is scandalous in this respect. It testifies not only very badly about the character of this man (Rosati - ed.), whom, by the way, I don't know and don't want to know, but also about his environment, which sends this kind of signal to Poles: you are to succumb to moral blackmail. If he said that: don't vote for the ruling party because it has bad policies, this is a normal thing in a democracy. If he writes: don't vote for the ruling party, because otherwise we won't get, that's some kind of horrendum. 
It was recalled that Radoslaw Sikorski, who has long announced a visit to Ukraine, still has not decided to travel. Perhaps he is still waiting for the approval of the European Parliament? How to look at this matter in the context of Donald Tusk's attitude towards the war in Ukraine, among others? MEP Witold Waszczykowski pointed out that the PO policy, "is the subordination of Polish foreign policy to German diplomacy".Do you agree with this opinion? 
Indeed, their political activity was very strongly connected with Germany. Minister Sikorski spoke about the need for German leadership, encouraged their leadership. Donald Tusk, in general, I think owes his European career to former Chancellor Angela Merkel, who was the most important person in the Union at the time, and it was she who pointed him there. So there is such a very clear tendency in them to do or say things that might meet with favor from the German side. This is also related to the fact that they are rabidly anti-government. Faced with this, they are always on the "no" side. Even if the thing concerns such an important issue as the war. The longer the war lasts, the issues become more complicated. Whether to support Ukraine's accession to the European Union, or to assist militarily, politically. Because the German and French governments are a bit more restrained, and the political option of the Platform has always been to stick with those, so they are also sticking now.  Thank you for the interview. Interviewed by Mateusz Majewski

text_EN:
We call on EU countries and allies to immediately suspend tourism and restrict the issuance of entry visas for Russians and expand sanctions so as to make it more difficult for Russia to continue the war, the heads of the foreign affairs committees of the parliaments of seven countries, including Poland, wrote in a joint statement. 
Joint statement on visas 
The statement was signed Thursday by the heads of the parliaments' SZ committees: Poland's MP Marek Kuchcinski, Estonia's MP Marko Mihkelson, Latvia's MP Rihards Kols, Lithuania's MP Laima Liucija Andrikiene, the Czech Republic's MP Marek Zeniszek, the heads of the Senate SZ committees of Poland's MP Bogdan Klich and the Czech Republic's MP Pavel Fischer, as well as Jussi Halla-aho, chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Parliament of the Republic of Finland, and Martin Lidegaard, head of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Folketinget of Denmark.  As chairman of the foreign affairs committees of our parliaments, in response to the continued - unprovoked and unjust - aggression war waged against Ukraine by the Russian Federation, we point out that these Russian aggression wars against sovereign Ukraine constitute a blatant violation of international law, including the UN Charter, and stress that since Russia's unprovoked military attack on Ukraine on February 24, 2022, twelve million Ukrainians have been forced to flee their homes, and more than five million have been forced to leave their country, the parliamentarians wrote. They also referred to a number of reports by human rights organizations and international monitoring missions on the atrocities committed by the Russian armed forces against Ukrainian civilians, including torture, rape, murder and mass detention of civilians in so-called "filtration centers," as well as mass deportations.  We emphasize the immoral and illegal nature of Russia's chosen tactics, the widespread use of extremely cruel, imprecise weapons that maim and cause particular suffering. Russia using this type of munitions violates international norms. Russian forces in Ukraine are using internationally banned cluster munitions to sow fear and indiscriminately kill civilians. We further stress that the deployment of Russian military personnel and armaments in Zaporizhia of Europe's largest nuclear power plant is unacceptable and disregards the safety and security principles set forth in the seven pillars of nuclear safety," they wrote. They also pointed out that the presence of Russian armed forces in Zaporizhia prevents the operator and the Ukrainian authorities from fulfilling their nuclear and radiological safety obligations under international conventions. Accordingly, they called on Russia to "immediately withdraw its armed forces and any other unauthorized personnel from the Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant, its immediate surroundings and all of Ukraine." 
Condemnation of Russian aggression against Ukraine
 The heads of the commission also expressed "the strongest condemnation of the Russian Federation's ongoing, unprovoked and unjustified aggression war against Ukraine." "The Russian Federation must immediately withdraw its troops from Ukraine's internationally recognized borders and respect Ukraine's territory and sovereignty". - they declared.  We call on the Euro-Atlantic community and its partners to urgently strengthen and implement comprehensive sanctions against the Russian Federation to halt the Russian army's ability to continue its military aggression in Ukraine, increase military, financial, humanitarian and diplomatic support for Ukraine, unanimously support initiatives condemning Russia's military actions in Ulmina and calling for the perpetrators to be brought to justice, isolating Russia from international and regional organizations, as well as adopting equivalent decisions and establishing equivalent sanctions against Belarus as a supporter of Russian military aggression, the politicians wrote in a statement. 
Call for suspension of visa issuance to Russians 
They also called on EU countries and other Western allies "to immediately suspend tourism and restrict the issuance of entry visas to citizens of the Russian Federation."   We commemorate all the victims of Russian aggression in Ukraine - thousands of civilians and defenders of Ukraine; we express solidarity with Ukraine and the Ukrainian people, the heads of the commission said. The Czech Republic, which currently holds the EU presidency, reported two weeks ago that a ban on visas for all Russian citizens could complement the EU sanctions against Moscow. Deputy Foreign Ministry spokesman Piotr Wawrzyk told PAP in an interview on August 14 that Poland was working on developing a concept that would allow visas not to be issued to Russian citizens. Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Denmark, among others, have made a similar decision in the context of banning tourist visas for Russians. Poland has not issued tourist visas to Russian citizens for several months. At present, they are only granted to Russians who are required to cross the Polish-Russian border due to their work, including truck drivers, diplomats, as well as holders of the Polish Charter and family members of citizens of Poland and other EU countries. Greece, Cyprus, Germany, as well as the head of EU diplomacy Josep Borrell, have spoken out against a complete ban on tourist visas for Russian citizens. The introduction of such a measure is supported - in addition to the three Baltic states of Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia - by Finland, Denmark, Norway, Poland and the Czech Republic. wkt/PAP

text_EN:
Criticism of priests and clericalism, the institutional rather than communal nature of the Church and a lack of sensitivity to people's needs are some of the conclusions of the nationwide synthesis summarizing the diocesan phase of the synod on synodality. 
A picture of a wounded Church 
The faithful focused primarily on articulating what hurts them in the Church community, according to the nationwide synod synthesis "Toward a Synodal Church: communion, participation, mission," released Thursday.  Participants in synod meetings shared a picture of a Church wounded, affected by scandals and human poverty, whose sinful side related to human weakness often causes scorn and suffering. It is a Church that is often helpless, affected by the shock of change, which often causes frustration among the faithful, resembling more a mismanaged institution than a community led by incisive shepherds, the document reads. Synod participants presented images of the Church illustrating its institutional rather than communal nature. They expressed the belief that "the Church is detached from life, boring, with too little talk about doubt and what faith means to us."  In the consultations and syntheses, the harsh criticism of priests, based primarily on their own parish experiences, was very clearly heard, the synthesis reads. 
Assessment of priests 
At the same time, the laity who took part in the synodal consultations highly valued in their priests "awareness of vocation, deep faith, true piety, living according to principles, attention to worship and teaching, concern for people, love for the Church, apolitical while engaging in social issues, selflessness and, above all, authenticity and witness." At the same time, the lay faithful perceived in the clergy "a lack of faith and authentic piety, materialism, violation of moral principles, lack of sensitivity to people's needs, poor quality of relations with the parish and local community, an erroneous anthropological vision, revealed in an extremely negative understanding of man, and finally a lack of building relationships among themselves and neglect of their own formation." The synodal consultations highlighted "deeply rooted and widespread clericalism."  It raises the "phenomenon of the unbelief of priests" who have "lost God" or sometimes show that the Church is "a giant business, a financial consortium," which translates into a sense of "not yet physical, but already spiritual shortage of priests,"  - according to the published synthesis. 
Need for prayer and strengthening of pastoral care 
The criticism was accompanied by a reflection on the need to pray for priests and support them in their work, and for the laity to develop a willingness to take joint responsibility for the parish. Many diocesan syntheses included demands such as the need to preach catechesis for adults, strengthen (or build from the beginning) the pastoral care of children, youth, families and the elderly, and extend pastoral care to those who remain to varying degrees on the periphery of the Church - especially those living in non-sacramental relationships, people with disabilities and LGBT+ people. The synodal consultations, at various levels, were attended mainly by faithful involved in parish life, members of communities, as well as practitioners and previously not directly involved in their parishes. Depending on the diocese, between 30 and 65 percent of parishes organized synodal meetings. Local coordinators in parishes made up a group of more than 6,800 people. In parishes, the synod was coordinated most often by priests. More than 100,000 people participated in synod consultations. The 16th General Assembly of the Synod of Bishops on the theme "Toward a Synodal Church: communion, participation, mission" runs from October 2021. For the first time in history, the first phase of the synod was consultations held at the diocesan level. Once these are completed, the continental phase will begin, followed by the universal phase in October 2023. 
Need for greater attention to liturgy and quality of homilies 
The faithful also pointed to the need for greater attention to liturgical celebrations, especially Sunday Mass. Attention was given to the need to eliminate perceived haste, abbreviated Mass (e.g., chants limited to one stanza), routine, lack of commitment, and the temptation to "treat celebrations quantitatively rather than qualitatively" (...). During the synod, the problem of the low level of homilies preached resounded, the document reads. Synod participants were discouraged by the moralistic tone of homilies, in which there is no room for the Good News and kerygma, the unpreparedness of priests, and sermons that are "too short or too long and convoluted." The issue of the failure to present Catholic social teaching properly was raised, so that many people perceive taking up the subject as preaching political sermons, sometimes even with personal references. Some of the faithful called for the creation of more places where it is possible to participate in the liturgy celebrated in the extraordinary rite (in the so-called traditional form). According to the synthesis, in the Church "we don't know how to listen, it makes it difficult for us, we prefer to speak and push our views." Most synod participants agreed that priests "often do not listen to the lay faithful, because they are not interested in their needs, but only in the implementation of the pastoral plan."  Listening is hindered by a belief in their own infallibility and by established communication patterns, they assessed.  When priests refuse to listen, finding excuses in, for example, a large number of activities, or when questions remain unanswered, a sense of sadness and alienation is born in the heart of the lay faithful, they said. Synod participants admitted that the laity also do not listen to priests or listen to them selectively. The laity also pointed to the bishops' lack of contact with the faithful. They expressed the expectation that "the bishops should be closer to ordinary people to talk to, because in the current form only a select few have access to the bishop."  In the statements made by participants in the meetings, both clergy and laity, there was an image of an aloof official bishop, uninterested in parish affairs, "detached from reality" and the problems the faithful live by, the synthesis reads. While voicing criticism of priests and demanding changes, participants in the diocesan phase of the synod made it clear that they flowed from "concern for the Church and a desire for charismatic priests who, through the word they preach and the example of their own lives, would draw the faithful to God and attract them to the Church." 
Concern for youth and those on the margins of the Church 
The published nationwide synod synthesis "Toward a Synodal Church: communion, participation, mission" shows that the life of the faithful happens primarily in families.  We are faced with the dramatic question of whether our Church includes our families (our domestic Church), and above all, whether there are still young people. What should we do so that we do not lose young people, especially those who, even if they have come out of believing families, do not want to continue on the path of the Church and do not identify with it?  - they asked. According to the synod participants, "for many young people +the Church is sad+. Young people do not feel encouraged to participate in the life of the Church, to receive the sacraments (especially Confirmation), the preparation for which, in the opinion of young people, is poorly conducted," they stipulated.   No one ever showed me that the Church is cool, I was just forced into everything over and over again," one participant wrote. The synthesis pointed out that there are people who feel marginalized in the Church community - those seeking a faith experience, those hurt by the clergy and by their anti-testimony, those living in non-sacramental relationships, LGBT+ people, people caught up in addictions and refugees. It was pointed out that people with disabilities, those with mobility difficulties and thus unable to participate fully in the life of the Church community, as well as people representing the traditionalist current, also feel excluded at times. Synod participants wondered whether pastors and committed lay faithful are too quick to give up on courting people with faith difficulties and crises. 
Criticism based on love for the Church
The chairman of the KEP, Archbishop Stanislaw G?decki, during the presentation of the nationwide synthesis summarizing the diocesan phase of the synod on synodality, said that criticism of the Church is present in the nationwide synthesis, but it is criticism stemming from love for the Church, not from hatred. He explained that the concept of a synod in the Western Church meant for centuries an assembly of bishops. As he explained, it was only recently, in 1983, that a distinction was made between a universal council and a synod of bishops. In contrast, the term synodality has emerged in recent decades.  In a synodal Church, the entire community ... is called to pray together, listen, analyze, dialogue, discern and counsel in pastoral decisions, he said. He pointed out that "in making important decisions, pastors must listen carefully to the wishes of the faithful."  This synod was primarily about listening to the voice of the Holy Spirit, Archbishop G?decki explained. He admitted that "the synod did not arouse mass interest.   Rather, it was a minority event and an event that moved primarily the elite," he assessed. According to the chairman of the Episcopal Church, "it is comforting to note that in the first place it led to raising the topic of parish and community."  Criticism of the Church is also present there, only it is a different kind of criticism than the one in the newspapers. That is, it is a criticism that does not come out of hatred of the Church, but a criticism out of love for the Church," he said. As Archbishop G?decki stipulated, the people who took part in the synodal teams emphasized the criticism, but at the same time pointed out that it is intended to serve "the renewal of the Church."  In this sense, this event seems to me to be very significant and surprising for the very practice of the Church so far, in the sense that there has not yet been such a synod to cover the whole world," he assessed. 
New quality of talking about the Church 
More than 100,000 people nationwide took part in the synod consultation. Asked by PAP - in view of this number - about a certain elitism of the synodal process, Archbishop G?decki confirmed that both nationally and in the Pozna? archdiocese "practically the number of those interested was very similar in percentage terms."  That is, there is some part of the people actively experiencing the life of the Church. Others, by not joining in, do not automatically say that they are not interested in the Church. They approve in part of the Church's teaching, try to live the life of the Church, well that is also their option, their way. Then there will also be a part that gives up or does not fit into the life of the Church at all - and these are the reasons why this is an elitist event," diagnosed the Metropolitan of Poznan.  The main surprise I had, meeting with those in charge of all the groups in the parishes, was that at a certain point a new language began to emerge, that is, a language I had not encountered before. A different, as it were, quality of language and talking about the Church with more sensitivity," assessed Archbishop G?decki.  Usually we have many meetings, gatherings, conferences - and we have a lot of experience talking to people - and different. However, here appeared - after 32 years of episcopacy - for me a really different category of speaking in and about the Church. This was most surprising: at one of these meetings I thought to myself that it would be very beautiful if this could be transferred to the whole diocese, to the whole Church," the chairman of the KEP illustrated. text_EN:
It's been six months since Putin's troops invaded Ukraine. Experts point out that the situation on the frontline has shown that the Kremlin dictator is not fixing his mistakes and has no new idea how to wage war. The US-based Institute for the Study of War (ISW), on the other hand, noted that since the peak of the invasion in March, Russia has lost control of an area larger than Denmark in Ukraine, and over the past 39 days has seized territory comparable only to the size of Andorra. What is Putin hoping for? Reuters sources indicate that he is waiting for the "Nature General" to act - cold winters helped Moscow defeat Napoleon and Hitler, so the Russian president is betting that rising energy prices will influence Europe's attitude to demand an end to the war, even on the Kremlin's terms. 
"Difficult winter for Europeans" 
According to two Russian sources familiar with the Kremlin leadership's thinking, this is the only path to peace acceptable to Moscow, given that Kiev refuses to negotiate until Russian forces have left all Ukrainian territory.  We have time, we can wait," said one source close to the Russian government, reserving his anonymity.  It will be a difficult winter for Europeans. There may be protests, riots. Some European leaders may abandon further support for Ukraine and come to the conclusion that it is time for a settlement, the source added. 
Cracks in European unity 
A second source close to the Kremlin said that Moscow's view is that cracks in European unity are already showing, and the process will accelerate with the difficulties of winter.  If this (i.e., the war) drags on into the fall and winter, it will be really difficult. So there is hope that (Ukrainians) will ask for peace," the Reuters interlocutor announced. The agency stresses that in view of significant military assistance from the US and the West, intelligence sharing by the allies and a series of successful attacks on Russian targets, the authorities in Kiev see a chance to change the situation on the front.  For negotiations with Russia to be possible, it is necessary to change the status quo on the front in favor of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Ukrainian presidential advisor Mykhailo Podolak told Reuters. He added that significant tactical defeats by the Russian army are necessary. Reuters points out that the war in Ukraine has raised energy prices to record levels, the EU has adopted a partial ban on Russian oil imports, while Russia has significantly reduced gas exports to Europe. EU governments are looking for alternative sources of supply in this situation and taking steps to conserve energy, but few energy experts think they will be able to meet their demand. 
Record revenues from gas and oil sales 
Meanwhile, the Kremlin's war efforts are fueled by record revenues from oil and gas sales.  The Kremlin is obviously counting on losing interest because of our own midterm elections in America, and because Britain will be looking for a new prime minister, Germany is panicky about gas, and the Rhine is only 15 cm deep, said retired U.S. General Ben Hodges, former commander of U.S. forces in Europe.  War is a test of logistics and a test of willpower. The test will be whether our will in the West is stronger than the will of the Kremlin. I think this will be a challenge," he added. The first Russian source quoted by Reuters said that Moscow wants to guarantee itself territorial gains, including the entire Donbas, as well as Kiev's commitment to military neutrality, in a future peace agreement. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenski, however, said Tuesday that Kiev would not agree to freeze the existing front line to appease Russia. Podolak, meanwhile, says Kiev is getting weapons from the West that are enough to avoid defeat, but not enough to win. According to U.S. officials, Putin has not abandoned his original goal of seizing Kiev, although he has not succeeded so far. They also assess that there are no signs that the Russians are moving toward de-escalation. 
Divisions in the West 
The direction of the war may be determined by Ukraine's track record on the battlefield until winter, according to RUSI think tank analyst Neil Melvin.   Ukraine must convince Western allies that it can win (on the battlefield) and achieve momentum. If, in the meantime, it manages to demonstrate that it can fend off the Russians and maintain momentum, it will be its victory, he said. However, the longer the war continues, the greater the risk of divisions among Western countries.   All economic indicators are now deteriorating. It will be more difficult to convince people freezing in their apartments (to accept the difficulties) if it is not seen that Ukraine is winning, Melvin announced. According to him, pressure for a political deal will then grow and could divide both the EU and NATO. Former British Ambassador to Russia Tony Brenton also believes that Russia may escalate the conflict if it faces a humiliating defeat.   If Russia has to choose between fighting a losing war, a painful defeat and Putin's downfall, or some nuclear show of force, I'm not sure it won't choose a nuclear show, he announced. Former UK government military adviser Samir Puri believes that if the dynamics of the war do not change, Ukraine may be forced to function in a de facto divided state, with Russia controlling up to a quarter of its territory.   Such a division is unfortunately the most likely outcome (of the war) in the medium term, he announced. Gen. Hodges is more optimistic, according to him, according to which Russia's logistics system is already exhausting its capabilities and this will not change anytime soon.   If the West, led by the U.S. and Britain, continues to deliver what it promises ... then I think Ukraine can push the Russians back to the February 23 line by the end of the year, he said.  wkt/PAP

"Any armament given to Ukraine is also a fight for Poland's security. I emphasize this in all conversations - if Ukraine had not started an armed struggle with Russia, we would already have a longer border with Russia and such hybrid attacks as those from Belarus would be child's play compared to what Putin would be doing if he could already hit us with his trolls at least from the direction of Lviv." - Gen. Roman Polko, former GROM commander, says in an interview with the wPolityce.pl portal. 
 wPolityce.pl: Ukraine still exists six months after the Russian invasion began, and today it celebrates its Independence Day. What conclusions can be drawn after this time? 
 Gen. Roman Polko: First of all, Ukrainians have proven their fortitude, patriotism and that they are brave and do not surrender to a much stronger aggressor. Ukraine is also rebuking Crimea, which was taken back in 2014, and is doing so effectively. I hope that the fighting spirit of the Ukrainians will continue as strong as it is now - I wish them this on the holiday of their independence. I also hope that the West will not lack perseverance in supporting Ukraine, because Ukraine has a chance to regain its territorial integrity - it is a fact, however, that this will not happen in a few months. I don't like to add that including Crimea, but it probably needs to be added, because some Western countries seem to have accepted that Crimea, contrary to the Budapest agreement, is occupied by Russia. I hope that Ukraine will also live to see all the destruction in the country repaired at the expense of the estates of Russian oligarchs. The payment of reparations is a condition for Ukraine to build normal relations with Russia in the future. Ukrainian soldiers are incredibly heroic, they fight to the end, they are determined, Ukraine also has a great leadership. However, it is also worth emphasizing the fact that at least President Andrzej Duda, on the issue of Ukraine, really behaves like the best statesman. You mentioned that some Western countries may not accept that Crimea is Ukrainian. Meanwhile, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who is judged differently in Europe, however, has no doubts on this issue - he believes that the return of Crimea to Ukraine is a requirement of international law. He agrees, but unfortunately, there are also voices from Hungary and disturbing opinion polls in Hungary, where the population has doubts on the matter, not exactly blaming Russia for the aggression. We also have the attitude of German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who, under pressure from his own public opinion, says he will support Ukraine, give it heavy equipment, while at the same time doing everything to delay these deliveries and even sabotaging such measures that are aimed at supporting Ukraine economically. This is also a very good verification of whether the value system that Western leaders sometimes invoke determines their functioning, or whether it is just thinking in terms of one's own full belly, one's own benefits, and whether Ukrainians die or not, we are talking to a despot, a terrorist Putin. This is the kind of thinking that, admittedly, so far Putin has cheated and reneged on agreements, but maybe if some European leader talks to him, he will succumb this time. It is the gullibility and stupidity of the useful idiots that this KGB man has acquired, perhaps he has some hooks into them. Fortunately, as in the Niemen song - there are more good people for now. You mentioned Chancellor Scholz - the Kiel Institute for the World Economy reported data showing that Germany has pledged $3.1 billion in military support to Ukraine, and Poland $2.99 billion. However, Poland has already donated $1.8 billion worth of equipment to Ukraine, while Germany has donated over $450 million worth of equipment. Looking at the economic potential, the economic potential, the capabilities that Germany has, it is indeed humiliating for the Germans themselves that their country, which aspires to be the leader of the EU, proves to be so weak when human lives need to be saved. When you have to prove that you are not a hypocrite and that indeed the European values we profess are important to us. What do you think is the most important thing for Ukraine to win this war? Here I will say one word - perseverance. This is what President Biden spoke about, and this is what our President Andrzej Duda has consistently implemented. I hope that such a line will also be continued by the British government. The West's persistence in supporting Ukraine economically and militarily has already resulted in Ukraine having equipment technologically more advanced than the Russians in many areas. At the moment we have a stalemate in this war, weariness, fatigue - you can't give up on this, you have to follow through, continue to support Ukraine. I hope that just as at some point Ukraine stopped being supplied only with light weapons, but also with heavy weapons - tanks, artillery, it's high time that aviation was added to this. It's hard to retake some territory if you don't control your own airspace. Any armament given to Ukraine is also a fight for Poland's security. I emphasize this in all conversations - if Ukraine had not taken up arms against Russia, we would already have a longer border with Russia, and such hybrid attacks as those from Belarus would be child's play compared to what Putin would be doing if he could already hit us with his trolls at least from the direction of Lviv. So do you think that if the Ukrainians did not resist, Poland would be among Russia's next targets? Definitely yes. I am very grateful to the Ukrainians, because they are also fighting for our independence. If someone doesn't see that, I feel sorry for them. Do you see any signs that there might be a breakthrough in this war in the near future? For a long time, the Ukrainian and Russian positions have been more or less in a stabilized line. There has already been some breakthrough in that the Ukrainians have begun to reach into Russia's operational depths. A huge breakthrough would be the destruction of the Crimea Bridge, but here, as a certified pyrotechnician, I know very well that blowing up such a bridge is not done by dropping a single bomb or rocket on it, only the right structural points have to be hit, and secondly, the explosive charge has to be large and strong enough. However, I hope it can be done. There is no doubt that Ukraine has reminded Russia that Crimea is its territory, has shown the resting tourists that this is really a war. On the other hand, he does not expect a breakthrough in this war in the coming weeks or months, it will continue to be such a creeping conflict with genocidal attacks by Russia and counterattacks by Ukraine. Maybe it won't be until the spring, or in even longer time, that the Ukrainians will train in the use of new equipment, get enough of it, and be able to launch a strong offensive that won't just be a reminder to the enemy that Ukrainians can also attack, but will lead to the liberation of the occupied territories. Interviewed by Adam Stankiewicz
